p: Cai et al. investigated four production wells comprising a range of 1620 m–2470 m depth and 35.5 °C–69.0 °C [ 1]. They found an increasing relative abundance of genes related to the degradation of aromatic compounds ( nahA, HBH, and pobA), carbon cycling and metabolism of other organic compounds with decreasing temperature and depth of oil-containing stratum. Stress response (heat shock), antibiotic resistance, and sulfur metabolism associated genes decreased with decreasing temperature [ 1].
